creditline: Gift of funds from the Paul and Sheila Steiner Charitable Trust
description: abstract organic shape made up of needle-like spikes, with smaller, lighter clumps in ULQ
medium: Computational drawing; archival inkjet on cotton rag paper
provenance: The artist, Minneapolis; sold to MIA, 2019.
signed: LRC in pencil: JMurphy | LLC in pencil: Heart Under Attack
text:
Minneapolis-based artist Jenna Murphy specialized in intaglio printmaking, particularly drypoint, before making the leap to digital drawing in 2017. Using sophisticated code, Jenna seeks to create complex, organic abstract drawings that defy their computational process and computer origins. The sharp shapes and larger amoeba-like form in Heart Under Attack seem to grow, move, and breathe spontaneously, The rich play of light on dark echoes the velvety effects of a handmade work of art. In the artist’s words, she is exploring how to achieve “similar tactile qualities through computational sketches. These recent studies aim to push the boundaries of what a contemporary drawing can be, with hopes to blur the lines
between the constructs of Fine and Digital arts.”
title: Heart Under Attack
